page.title: 18Home Farm, near Fraserburgh
page.content: Home farm is near Fraserburgh.There is the last remaining wing of Philorth house which was built in 1873.That is where the Frasers and Saltouns lived but now the Andersons have taken over the estate.Altogether there are 1200 acres,including 116 acres of grass. They grow turnips,wheat,winter barley, spring barley,and peas for cattle feed.The barley has not grown well because they were late in sowing due to the wet spring.They need warm weather or they will lose the crop. They keep cattle,sheep and horses.The cattle are kept for their beef.They are mostly crossbreeds.It is important to keep dogs on a lead because the farmer found a dog eating a lamb.There is a market garden which sells veg.and fruit to local shops. Mrs. Anderson said "There's always something happening. Life is never dull."
